Detailed Description

template<class T>
class Quaternion< T >

Quaternion class implementing some quaternion algebra operations.

Quaternion is kind of complex number it consists of its real part (w) and its complex part v. This complex part has three elements, so we can express it as xi + yj + zk . Note that coordinates of (x,y,z) are hold inside v field.

bool Quaternion< T >::operator== ( const Quaternion< T > &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Equality test operator.

Parameters:
rhs Right hand side argument of binary operator.
Note:
Test of equality is based of threshold EPSILON value. To be two values equal, must satisfy this condition | lws - rhs | < EPSILON, for all quaternion coordinates.

02415             const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;

Note:

02540          {
02541             Matrix4<T> ret;
02542                 
02543             T xx = v.x * v.x;
02544             T xy = v.x * v.y;
02545             T xz = v.x * v.z;
02546             T xw = v.x * w;
02547                 
02548             T yy = v.y * v.y;
02549             T yz = v.y * v.z;

02551

02553             T zw = v.z * w;
02554                 
02555             ret.at(0,0) = 1 - 2 * (yy + zz);
02556             ret.at(1,0) = 2 * (xy - zw);
02557             ret.at(2,0) = 2 * (xz + yw);
02558             ret.at(3,0) = 0;
02559                 
02560             ret.at(0,1) = 2 * (xy + zw);
02561             ret.at(1,1) = 1 - 2 * (xx + zz);

02563             ret.at(3,1) = 0;
02564

02567             ret.at(2,2) = 1 - 2 * (xx + yy);
02568             ret.at(3,2) = 0;
02569 
02570             ret.at(0,3) = 0;
02571             ret.at(1,3) = 0;
02572             ret.at(2,3) = 0;
02573             ret.at(3,3) = 1;
02574                 
02575             return ret;
02576

const Quaternion< T > &  rhs 
) const [inline]

Linear interpolation of two quaternions.

Parameters:
fact Factor of interpolation. For translation from positon of this vector to quaternion rhs, values of factor goes from 0.0 to 1.0.
rhs Second Quaternion for interpolation
Note:
Hovewer values of fact parameter are reasonable only in interval [0.0 , 1.0], you can pass also values outside of this interval and you can get result (extrapolation?) 
02589          {
02590             return Quaternion<T>((1-fact) * w + fact * rhs.w, v.lerp(fact, rhs.v));

template<class T>
static Quaternion<T> Quaternion< T >::fromMatrix ( const Matrix4< T > &  m  )  [inline, static]

Creates quaternion from transform matrix.

Parameters:
m Transfrom matrix used to compute quaternion.
Returns:
Quaternion representing rotation of matrix m. 
02609          {
02610             Quaternion<T> q;
02611                                                 
02612             T tr,s;
02613             tr = m.at(0,0) + m.at(1,1) + m.at(2,2);
02614             if (tr >= epsilon)
02615             {
02616                s = (T)sqrt(tr + 1);
02617                q.w = 0.5 * s;
02618                s = 0.5 / s;
02619                                                          
02620                q.v.x = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02621                q.v.y = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) * s;
02622                q.v.z = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) * s;
02623             }
02624             else
02625             {
02626                T d0 = m.at(0,0);
02627                T d1 = m.at(1,1);
02628                T d2 = m.at(2,2);
02629                                                          
02630                char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2)? 0 : 2) : ((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
02631                                                          
02632                if (bigIdx == 0)
02633                {
02634                   s = (T)sqrt((d0 - (d1 + d2)) + 1);
02635                                                                         
02636                   q.v.x = 0.5 * s;
02637                   s = 0.5 / s;
02638                   q.v.y = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) * s;
02639                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) * s;
02640                   q.w = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02641                }
02642                else if (bigIdx == 1)
02643                {
02644                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d1 - (d0 + d2));
02645                   q.v.y = 0.5 * s;
02646                   s = 0.5 / s;
02647                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02648                   q.w = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) / s;
02649                   q.v.x = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) / s;
02650                }
02651                else
02652                {
02653                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d2 - (d0 + d1));
02654                   q.v.z = 0.5 * s;
02655                   s = 0.5 / s;
02656                   q.w = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) / s;
02657                   q.v.x = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) / s;
02658                   q.v.y = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02659                }
02660             }
02661                                                 
02662             return q;
02663          }

template<class T>
static Quaternion<T> Quaternion< T >::fromMatrix ( const Matrix3< T > &  m  )  [inline, static]

Creates quaternion from rotation matrix.

Parameters:
m Rotation matrix used to compute quaternion.
Returns:
Quaternion representing rotation of matrix m. 
02672          {
02673             Quaternion<T> q;
02674                                                 
02675             T tr,s;
02676             tr = m.at(0,0) + m.at(1,1) + m.at(2,2);
02677             // if trace is greater or equal then zero
02678             if (tr >= epsilon)
02679             {
02680                s = (T)sqrt(tr + 1);
02681                q.w = 0.5 * s;
02682                s = 0.5 / s;
02683                                                          
02684                q.v.x = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02685                q.v.y = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) * s;
02686                q.v.z = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) * s;
02687             }
02688             else
02689             {
02690                T d0 = m.at(0,0);
02691                T d1 = m.at(1,1);
02692                T d2 = m.at(2,2);
02693                                                          
02694                // find greates diagonal number
02695                char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2)? 0 : 2) : ((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
02696                                                          
02697                if (bigIdx == 0)
02698                {
02699                   s = (T)sqrt((d0 - (d1 + d2)) + 1);
02700                                                                         
02701                   q.v.x = 0.5 * s;
02702                   s = 0.5 / s;
02703                   q.v.y = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) * s;
02704                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) * s;
02705                   q.w = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02706                }
02707                else if (bigIdx == 1)
02708                {
02709                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d1 - (d0 + d2));
02710                   q.v.y = 0.5 * s;
02711                   s = 0.5 / s;
02712                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02713                   q.w = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) / s;
02714                   q.v.x = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) / s;
02715                }
02716                else
02717                {
02718                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d2 - (d0 + d1));
02719                   q.v.z = 0.5 * s;
02720                   s = 0.5 / s;
02721                   q.w = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) / s;
02722                   q.v.x = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) / s;
02723                   q.v.y = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02724                }
02725             }
02726                                                 
02727             return q;
02728          }

template<class T>
Quaternion<T> Quaternion< T >::slerp ( T  r,
const Quaternion< T > &  q2 
) const [inline]

Computes spherical interpolation between quaternions (this, q2) using coeficient of interpolation r (in [0, 1]).

Parameters:
r The ratio of interpolation form this (r = 0) to q2 (r = 1).
q2 Second quaternion for interpolation.
Returns:
Result of interpolation. 
02739          {
02740             Quaternion<T> ret;
02741             T cosTheta = w * q2.w + v.x * q2.v.x + v.y *q2.v.y + v.z * q2.v.z;
02742             T theta = (T) acos(cosTheta);
02743             if (fabs(theta) < epsilon)
02744             {
02745                ret = *this;
02746             }
02747             else
02748             {
02749                T sinTheta = (T)sqrt(1.0 - cosTheta * cosTheta);
02750                if (fabs(sinTheta) < epsilon)
02751                {
02752                   ret.w = 0.5 * w + 0.5 * q2.w;
02753                   ret.v = v.lerp(0.5, q2.v);
02754                }
02755                else
02756                {
02757                   T rA = (T)sin((1.0 - r) * theta) / sinTheta;
02758                   T rB = (T)sin(r * theta) / sinTheta;
02759                                                                         
02760                   ret.w = w * rA + q2.w * rB;
02761                   ret.v.x = v.x * rA + q2.v.x * rB;
02762                   ret.v.y = v.y * rA + q2.v.y * rB;
02763                   ret.v.z = v.z * rA + q2.v.z * rB;
02764                }
02765             }
02766             return ret;
02767          }
